channel.title: Python server
channel.description:
i just dug this up, awhile ago i wrote it when learning python, it's most likely very bad in the eyes of someone who knows python.
i was working with the beyondrsc client when i was doing it which is slightly modded, so it may only work with that. it's very basic but is enough to log in and start handling game packets.
http://uppit.com/9wqlauqhv3xf/server.zip

item.title: Python server
item.dc:creator: @Zilent Zilent
item.description:
@Zilent wrote:

So you finally ‘finished’ it Did you get the feeling of losing control as the program grew larger? I’ve heard that sort of thing happens with python on large scale projects.

Also, ever consider a Delphi based server? I’d be able to write up some assembler inserts for it if you ever decide to look into it.

GJ btw

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Old_Rsc_Player Old Rsc Player
item.description:
@Old_Rsc_Player wrote:

Whats the benefits of using python > java?
